results.title: One way ticket: a film about the abuse of drugs
results.creator_credit: Edmund Marshal, Denham Wright and Magpie Film Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary on the subject of drugs in modern society. Discusses some of the more important effects of cannabis, LSD, amphetamines, barbiturates, and, to a lesser extent, heroin. Intended as part of a teaching program for children aged 14-17 years.

results.title: One in a million
results.creator_credit: Government of Tasmania Department of Film Production
results.brief_description: An experiment in the fluoridation of drinking water by Beaconsfield Council, Tasmania. The local chemist was the driving force in having the Council add the necessary one part fluoride to a million parts of water. Comparisons over the years of teeth of children brought up on Council’s fluoridated water supply and the teeth of children from outlying areas using tank water amply justifies fluoridation. The benefit to general health, cost and lack of adverse effects on persons or industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Government of Tasmania Department of Film Production

results.title: One day in the life of Rajko Maksim
results.brief_description: A look at a goose herd in rural Yugoslavia. From early morning Rajku Maksim gathers together the villagers’ geese until it is time to return them at dusk. A non-narrated photographic essay. Suitable for upper primary level.
